FL.content: force used strategically in deconstruction, risks substantialism or irrationalism if its differential character is not stressed
FL.linkedContent: force used strategically in deconstruction, risks substantialism or irrationalism if its differential character is not stressed

FL.content: Derrida often calls, recalls himself, for/to vigilance, to risks spread by this word: 1) risk of obscure, substantialist occulto-mystic concept 2) risk of authorizing violent, unjust, arbitrary force > to avoid substantialism must recall differential character of force, force as differance, differance is a force différée-différante [“performative” force]
FL.linkedContent: Derrida often calls, recalls himself, for/to vigilance, to risks spread by this word: 1) risk of obscure, substantialist occulto-mystic concept 2) risk of authorizing violent, unjust, arbitrary force > to avoid substantialism must recall differential character of force, force as differance, differance is a force différée-différante [“performative” force]

POOF.content: via Montaigne, time of name [“inexplicable force of destiny”?] bestows force of approach, power of proximity or ‘union’ that defies discourse: the name against discourse (before/after), name as force, affection, mediation (these nameless concepts, w/out common names)
POOF.linkedContent: via Montaigne, time of name [“inexplicable force of destiny”?] bestows force of approach, power of proximity or ‘union’ that defies discourse: the name against discourse (before/after), name as force, affection, mediation (these nameless concepts, w/out common names)

POOF.content: [re: fraternal politics] women don’t have no chance, they have less > hegemony always relation of forces, laws of structure are tendential, impossibility of sheer (plus ou simple) exclusion, account for return of repressed, etc.
POOF.linkedContent: [re: fraternal politics] women don’t have no chance, they have less > hegemony always relation of forces, laws of structure are tendential, impossibility of sheer (plus ou simple) exclusion, account for return of repressed, etc.

PAS.content: “quand il la tient, il touche cette force d’approche qui rassemble la proximité, et, dans cette proximité, tout le lointain et tout le dehors”
PAS.linkedContent: “quand il la tient, il touche cette force d’approche qui rassemble la proximité, et, dans cette proximité, tout le lointain et tout le dehors”

PAS.content: this is the force, or rather the difference of force
PAS.linkedContent: this is the force, or rather the difference of force

PAS.content: force is excessive because it is different, different than itself, double
PAS.linkedContent: force is excessive because it is different, different than itself, double

FSW.content: distinction of force & meaning is derivative in relation to archi-trace
FSW.linkedContent: distinction of force & meaning is derivative in relation to archi-trace

F.content: Abraham and Torok: topos & force attempt the impossible, to grasp through language source from which language emanates
F.linkedContent: Abraham and Torok: topos & force attempt the impossible, to grasp through language source from which language emanates

POS.content: incision of deconstruction (not voluntary decision, not absolute beginning) occurs along lines of force, forces of rupture, that are localizable in discourse to be deconstructed
POS.linkedContent: incision of deconstruction (not voluntary decision, not absolute beginning) occurs along lines of force, forces of rupture, that are localizable in discourse to be deconstructed

S.content: that a spirit is force and is not force, has and does not have force, is a relation to double, a relation to haunting; Entmachtung (destitution) is inevitable (fatale), since ghost of spirit is never perceived
S.linkedContent: that a spirit is force and is not force, has and does not have force, is a relation to double, a relation to haunting; Entmachtung (destitution) is inevitable (fatale), since ghost of spirit is never perceived

FS.content: structuralism & literary criticism (structuralist in essence/destiny), lapse of attention paid to force (the tension of force itself) > even take revenge on force by declaring separation the condition of the work
FS.linkedContent: structuralism & literary criticism (structuralist in essence/destiny), lapse of attention paid to force (the tension of force itself) > even take revenge on force by declaring separation the condition of the work

FS.content: form fascinates when one no longer has force to understand force w/in itself [decadence?]
FS.linkedContent: form fascinates when one no longer has force to understand force w/in itself [decadence?]

FS.content: panoramagram (image of structuralist instrument): obtain on flat surface, depth of objects on horizon > one can glance at field divested of its forces
FS.linkedContent: panoramagram (image of structuralist instrument): obtain on flat surface, depth of objects on horizon > one can glance at field divested of its forces

FS.content: like melancholy for Gide, structural criticism only possible after defeat of force: a reflection of the constituted, constructed: historical, eschatological, crepuscular
FS.linkedContent: like melancholy for Gide, structural criticism only possible after defeat of force: a reflection of the constituted, constructed: historical, eschatological, crepuscular

FS.content: Leibniz critiqued Descartes for having explained everything in nature w/ figures & movements, of ignoring force by confusing it w/ quantity of movement [Derrida extending this critique to structuralism, Rousset, the best literary formalism]
FS.linkedContent: Leibniz critiqued Descartes for having explained everything in nature w/ figures & movements, of ignoring force by confusing it w/ quantity of movement [Derrida extending this critique to structuralism, Rousset, the best literary formalism]

FS.content: in structuralism, structure as one w/ geometrism: preformationsim, teleologism, reduction of force, value & duration
FS.linkedContent: in structuralism, structure as one w/ geometrism: preformationsim, teleologism, reduction of force, value & duration

FS.content: Hegel demonstrated that explication of a phenomenon by a force is tautology; yet, one must consider this w/in language’s inability to emerge from itself, not solely w/in thought of force
FS.linkedContent: Hegel demonstrated that explication of a phenomenon by a force is tautology; yet, one must consider this w/in language’s inability to emerge from itself, not solely w/in thought of force

FS.content: force is the other of language [by articulating it, becomes a phenomenon]
FS.linkedContent: force is the other of language [by articulating it, becomes a phenomenon]

FS.content: like structuralism, no concept of force in Husserl (brings phenomenology back to Platonism despite professed anti-Platonism); for Husserl, truth requires forgetting [of genesis, force, failure, crises]
FS.linkedContent: like structuralism, no concept of force in Husserl (brings phenomenology back to Platonism despite professed anti-Platonism); for Husserl, truth requires forgetting [of genesis, force, failure, crises]

FS.content: philosophy as twilight of forces, “sun-splashed (ensoleillé)” morning of images, forms, phenomena > matin des idées et des idoles, où le relief des forces devient repos, aplatit sa profondeur dans la lumière et s'étend dans l'horizontalité
FS.linkedContent: philosophy as twilight of forces, “sun-splashed (ensoleillé)” morning of images, forms, phenomena > matin des idées et des idoles, où le relief des forces devient repos, aplatit sa profondeur dans la lumière et s'étend dans l'horizontalité

FS.content: Apollonian ecstasy cannot embrace force, movement which displaces lines, nor force as desire for itself, nor writing > fallen Dionysianism, melancholy, nostalgia
FS.linkedContent: Apollonian ecstasy cannot embrace force, movement which displaces lines, nor force as desire for itself, nor writing > fallen Dionysianism, melancholy, nostalgia

DIF.content: Nietzsche: “difference of quantity is the essence of force, the relation of force to force”
DIF.linkedContent: Nietzsche: “difference of quantity is the essence of force, the relation of force to force”

TB.content: untranslatability less to do w/ adequation than unique occurrence of a performative of force
TB.linkedContent: untranslatability less to do w/ adequation than unique occurrence of a performative of force

DST.content: rhythm: spaced repetition of a percussion, inscriptive force (insensible) of a spacing > doesn’t belong to visible/audible figuration—still structures them (rhythmotypical, typorhythmic)
DST.linkedContent: rhythm: spaced repetition of a percussion, inscriptive force (insensible) of a spacing > doesn’t belong to visible/audible figuration—still structures them (rhythmotypical, typorhythmic)

AFR.content: passage (continuity and/or rupture) from one operation to an other always amounts to difference, quantity, of force > via analogy, this quantity of force is always that of connection
AFR.linkedContent: passage (continuity and/or rupture) from one operation to an other always amounts to difference, quantity, of force > via analogy, this quantity of force is always that of connection

AFR.content: innovation as revelation, analysis as analogical process, energy connecting present to absent > concept of force as force of repetition (retracing, supplying)
AFR.linkedContent: innovation as revelation, analysis as analogical process, energy connecting present to absent > concept of force as force of repetition (retracing, supplying)

AFR.content: Derrida sees here a silent explosion in text or fission in each concept (Condillac, elsewhere, denounces obscurantist force of “metaphor” [hence analogical value])
AFR.linkedContent: Derrida sees here a silent explosion in text or fission in each concept (Condillac, elsewhere, denounces obscurantist force of “metaphor” [hence analogical value])

AFR.content: for Condillac, primitive sense of force, attraction (a force that draws), proceeds from feeling of effort (sensible, physical), is transferred “figuratively” to metaphor [Derrida exposes how de Biran overplays notion of force in Condillac, which Condillac denounces elsewhere]
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, primitive sense of force, attraction (a force that draws), proceeds from feeling of effort (sensible, physical), is transferred “figuratively” to metaphor [Derrida exposes how de Biran overplays notion of force in Condillac, which Condillac denounces elsewhere]

AFR.content: insistence (quantity/quality of insistence), force, not a secondary value in philosophical discourse
AFR.linkedContent: insistence (quantity/quality of insistence), force, not a secondary value in philosophical discourse

AFR.content: force, analogy, signification will always be ordered to a theory of need (don’t rush to oppose to theory of desire)
AFR.linkedContent: force, analogy, signification will always be ordered to a theory of need (don’t rush to oppose to theory of desire)

PSSS.content: for Freud, force against force, deferred economy of force: makes right (passage from violence to law)
PSSS.linkedContent: for Freud, force against force, deferred economy of force: makes right (passage from violence to law)

D.content: trace can only imprint itself by referring to another trace (the other), letting itself be upstaged (outrepasser)/forgotten: its force of production stands in relation to energy of its erasure
D.linkedContent: trace can only imprint itself by referring to another trace (the other), letting itself be upstaged (outrepasser)/forgotten: its force of production stands in relation to energy of its erasure

D.content: innumerable as force, blows up (or out of) all frames, & it works through it (taken into account) from the inside [Kant’s mathematical sublime?]
D.linkedContent: innumerable as force, blows up (or out of) all frames, & it works through it (taken into account) from the inside [Kant’s mathematical sublime?]

+R.content: force of trait (disjointed forms a work): systasis of powerful ligatures holds, binds, disjecta membra, ladder is a scaffold, a synonym of POTENCE, garroted, bound (pillars, columns, frames, capitals)
+R.linkedContent: force of trait (disjointed forms a work): systasis of powerful ligatures holds, binds, disjecta membra, ladder is a scaffold, a synonym of POTENCE, garroted, bound (pillars, columns, frames, capitals)

LI.content: Derrida’s uneasiness about using words “force” and “power” [eg. Foucault’s micropowers]—he has 3 conditions for using them: 1) no power/force, only differences of power/force (like Nietzsche) 2) realize the greater force could be the “lesser” 3) account for fact that force/power quickly trapped in ruses of mastery
LI.linkedContent: Derrida’s uneasiness about using words “force” and “power” [eg. Foucault’s micropowers]—he has 3 conditions for using them: 1) no power/force, only differences of power/force (like Nietzsche) 2) realize the greater force could be the “lesser” 3) account for fact that force/power quickly trapped in ruses of mastery

TN.content: touch is finitude, period, stop at this point > l’efforcement (forceful exertion) always signs a finitude
TN.linkedContent: touch is finitude, period, stop at this point > l’efforcement (forceful exertion) always signs a finitude

TN.content: force & virtual force (Jesus recognizes this mysterious force when someone touches him)
TN.linkedContent: force & virtual force (Jesus recognizes this mysterious force when someone touches him)

TN.content: self-relation, “s’efforcer” > institutes/born to itself as exertion moment when limit insists, resists > efforcement as effort/limit, a finite force s’arrête, and se replie toward itself depuis sa fin
TN.linkedContent: self-relation, “s’efforcer” > institutes/born to itself as exertion moment when limit insists, resists > efforcement as effort/limit, a finite force s’arrête, and se replie toward itself depuis sa fin

TN.content: Husserl & Kant begin w/ received impression, sensation, the “primary faculty” > thus we only imagine force, only know its phenomenal effects [?]
TN.linkedContent: Husserl & Kant begin w/ received impression, sensation, the “primary faculty” > thus we only imagine force, only know its phenomenal effects [?]

WOG.content: Derrida explains why he prefers to speak of force (differential force) rather than power or will to power > anti-voluntarism, etc.
WOG.linkedContent: Derrida explains why he prefers to speak of force (differential force) rather than power or will to power > anti-voluntarism, etc.

BSi.content: Pascal: justice w/out force is impotent
BSi.linkedContent: Pascal: justice w/out force is impotent

BSi.content: if very meaning of lexicon of bêtise, being-bête, is not absolutely translatable (abyss of translation), one cannot reserve bêtise for man as sovereign & free > if meaning is linked to relation of forces, distinction btwn reaction/response loses its rigor and decidability [must revise everything]
BSi.linkedContent: if very meaning of lexicon of bêtise, being-bête, is not absolutely translatable (abyss of translation), one cannot reserve bêtise for man as sovereign & free > if meaning is linked to relation of forces, distinction btwn reaction/response loses its rigor and decidability [must revise everything]

BSi.content: Derrida intentionally using “a Nietzschean-style language more acceptable to Deleuze”: force, differential, intensity (not Freudian unconscious)
BSi.linkedContent: Derrida intentionally using “a Nietzschean-style language more acceptable to Deleuze”: force, differential, intensity (not Freudian unconscious)

BSi.content: force-differential (unconscious mechanisms) btwn which tension/contradiction bound to localize > bêtise on both sides: side of sovereign (who), side of beast, the stupid, the other (what)
BSi.linkedContent: force-differential (unconscious mechanisms) btwn which tension/contradiction bound to localize > bêtise on both sides: side of sovereign (who), side of beast, the stupid, the other (what)

BSi.content: pitiless lucidity of cogito, triumph of conscious self-positing self, the thesis of self always reflects itself as bêtise, bêtise always triumphs > Triumph of Life in bêtise ——bêtise always on side of victor > bêtise must not find itself bête: that would be suicidal
BSi.linkedContent: pitiless lucidity of cogito, triumph of conscious self-positing self, the thesis of self always reflects itself as bêtise, bêtise always triumphs > Triumph of Life in bêtise ——bêtise always on side of victor > bêtise must not find itself bête: that would be suicidal

BSi.content: Valéry: weakness of force to believe only in force
BSi.linkedContent: Valéry: weakness of force to believe only in force

BSi.content: appeal to reason, a reason that is not one, as fact of name and force of the stronger
BSi.linkedContent: appeal to reason, a reason that is not one, as fact of name and force of the stronger

OG.content: for Rousseau, “moral love” reflects history as denaturalization, this moral supplement is nothing, but still causes preference, forces force
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, “moral love” reflects history as denaturalization, this moral supplement is nothing, but still causes preference, forces force
